data.question: What is the synthesis condition for the material with the highest formula weight mentioned?
data.answer: The synthesis condition for the material with the highest formula weight mentioned (C12 H12 Ag B F4 N6, 434.96) involves a triclinic crystal system with a space group of P-1(2).

data.question: Which material has a crystal system described as orthorhombic and what is its space group?
data.answer: The material with a crystal system described as orthorhombic has a space group of Fddd(70).

data.question: For the material with the formula C6 H6 Ag B F4 N3, what are the differences in synthesis conditions between 2a and 2b?
data.answer: The differences in synthesis conditions between 2a and 2b for the material with the formula C6 H6 Ag B F4 N3 include different crystal systems (Monoclinic for 2a and Orthorhombic for 2b) and different space groups (P21/n(14) for 2a and Fddd(70) for 2b).

data.answer: True

data.answer: True

data.answer: The common feature in the synthesis conditions of materials with formula weights 314.82 and 434.96 is that both are synthesized at a temperature of 293(2) K.

data.answer: The formula weight of the material synthesized in a triclinic crystal system is 434.96.

data.answer: False

data.answer: All materials mentioned share the synthesis condition of being synthesized at a temperature of 293(2) K.

data.answer: The formula weight of the material synthesized in the space group P21/n(14) is 314.82.

data.answer: The material with the space group F2dd(43) is described in an orthorhombic crystal system.

data.question: What distinguishes the synthesis conditions of materials with space groups P21/n(14) and Fddd(70)?
data.answer: The synthesis conditions that distinguish materials with space groups P21/n(14) and Fddd(70) include their crystal systems (Monoclinic for P21/n(14) and Orthorhombic for Fddd(70)) and their different space groups.
